required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Retrospective Study of 110 Cases of Uterine Rupture to Determine Obstetric and Neonatal Complications
clinical_study.official_title: Retrospective Study of 110 Cases of Uterine Rupture to Determine Obstetric and Neonatal Complications

brief_summary.textblock: This study has for objective to collect medical data from patients with uterine rupture at the childbirth.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a retrospective study, gathering data of five maternity in the department of Val d'Oise in France, during 13 years (between 01/01/2000 an 31/12/2013).
The incidence of uterine rupture increases with increasing cesarean rates. It occurs at a rate of 0.08% across all childbirths in France, and 0.5 to 1% of the childbirths on cicatricial uterus in France.
Although the risk factors are known, it is usually unexpected. This is a serious complication for the mother (mortality <1%, severe morbidity at 15% ) and for the child (mortality for 3 to 6 % for childbirth at term, neonatal asphyxia for 6 to 15%) that can occur during pregnancy or during labor.

primary_outcome.measure: Identify maternal and foetal risk factors associated to an uterine rupture ; by the report of events during pregnancy, pathology, lifestyle, Concomitant pathology...

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of maternal and foetal adverse events associated to an uterine rupture at the childbirth.

arm_group.description: No intervention. Follow-up of women with uterine rupture at the childbirth.

intervention.description: No intervention. Follow-up of women with rupture uterine at the childbirth.

study_pop.textblock: Women with rupture uterine at the childbirth.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Childbirth with uterine rupture
Exclusion Criteria:
- Childbirth in a maternity which do not participate to the study
